Articles.Content:
Hello there everyone!

I am kind of new to KSP, but I have had a lot of fun playing it so far. 

I have just completed my first Minimus landing + return to kerbin, and didn't blow up that much at all. 

In order to blow up even less, I decided it would be good to talk to people who are more experienced with the game, so here I am.

Hello Fireclaw27 and welcome to the forum!

We have an immense amount of experience available around here to learn from as well as a very helpful community, especially if you want to learn how not to blow up much. 

We are all currently very occupied with checking out the newly released version 1.1.

Happy landings!

Hello there!

We are indeed excellently experienced when it comes to blow up stuff make orbit, true!
Happy launches and landings!

Edited April 22, 2016 by Mikki
Hmm... I beg to differ on the "blow stuff up" part...
I like blowing stuff up! Like big 2000 ton rockets! If don't want to blow stuff up, I advise testing it on sandbox first.

Hi @Fireclaw27, welcome to the community of fellow mad scientists rocket enthusiasts. It is good to learn from others what works and what not to do (initially).

Enjoy your time here.
